example_sentences.eng_trans: The children were playing [at play] in the backyard.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 子供たちは裏庭で遊んでいた

example_sentences.eng_trans: Work hard, play hard./〈ことわざ〉 All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy.
I had a good time [amused myself, enjoyed myself, relaxed, had a drink] at Shinjuku after work last night.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 昨夜仕事が終わってから新宿で遊んだ

example_sentences.eng_trans: They amused [enjoyed] themselves (by) playing cards./They played cards.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 彼らはトランプをして遊んだ

example_sentences.eng_trans: I am so busy with my work these days that I've got no time to enjoy myself.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: ここのところ仕事が忙しくて遊ぶひまがないんだ

example_sentences.eng_trans: I'd like to find a job because I can't be idle [〈軽蔑的〉 fool around].
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 遊んでばかりもいられないので仕事を見つけたい

example_sentences.eng_trans: He idled his life away./He loafed through his life.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 彼は一生遊んで暮らした

example_sentences.eng_trans: There are a lot of machines lying idle in the factory.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: その工場には遊んでいる機械が多い

example_sentences.eng_trans: He spent a lot of time and money on pleasure [led a very dissipated life, 〈話〉 womanized] when he was single.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 彼は独身のときは相当遊んだ
